paragraphs.text:
%md
# About
**Lab:** Hive SQL and File Formats
**Objective:** Become familiar with using Hive with different file formats
**File locations:** /labs/data/dc-wikia-data.csv
**Successful outcome:** Understanding hive file formats
**Before you begin:**
**Related lessons:** Hive Programming and Beeline Lab completion

---

%md
# Setup

paragraphs.title: Get the data from github and store it in HDFS
paragraphs.text:
%sh

rm dc-wikia-data.csv*
wget https://github.com/fivethirtyeight/data/raw/master/comic-characters/dc-wikia-data.csv
hdfs dfs -rm /labs/data/dc-wikia-data.csv
hdfs dfs -put dc-wikia-data.csv /labs/data/

paragraphs.title: Store the data in a parquet file
paragraphs.text:
%spark

val df = spark.read.format("csv").option("header", "true").load("/labs/data/dc-wikia-data.csv")
val df_new = df.select((col("page_id")),
                       (col("name")),
                       (col("urlslug")),
                       (col("ID")),
                       (col("ALIGN")),
                       (col("EYE")),
                       (col("HAIR")),
                       (col("SEX")),
                       (col("GSM")),
                       (col("APPEARANCES")),
                       (col("FIRST APPEARANCE").alias("FA")),
                       (col("YEAR")))
df_new.write.mode("overwrite").parquet("/labs/data/dc-wkia-data.parquet")

%md
# Lab
- For this Lab we will use Hive Interactive query.
- Prefix all queries with %jdbc(hive_interactive)

%md
### Hive table with data stored in parquet formet

We are going to create a table where data is stored in parquet format.

~~~
 CREATE TABLE dc_comics_parquet( 
                        page_id string,
                        name string,
                        urlslug string,
                        ID string,
                        ALIGN string,
                        EYE string,
                        HAIR string,
                        SEX string,
                        GSM string,
                        ALIVE string,
                        APPEARANCES string,
                        FIRST_APPEARANCES string,
                        YEAR string
) STORED AS Parquet;
~~~

But first we need to drop the table if it already exists.

paragraphs.title: 1 - Drop table dc_comics_parquet if it exists
2- Create and describe the table

paragraphs.text:
%md

### Hive table with data stored using the ORC format

We are going to create an exterrnal raw table that will be used to load data in an orc table.

~~~
CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE dc_comics_orc_raw ( 
                        page_id string,
                        name string,
                        urlslug string,
                        ID string,
                        ALIGN string,
                        EYE string,
                        HAIR string,
                        SEX string,
                        GSM string,
                        ALIVE string,
                        APPEARANCES string,
                        FIRST_APPEARANCES string,
                        YEAR string
) ROW FORMAT DELIMITED
FIELDS TERMINATED BY ',' LOCATION '/user/zeppelin/dc_comics/' 
~~~

But first we need to drop the table if it already exists.

paragraphs.title: 5 - Drop the dc_comics_orc_raw table if it exists and create the table

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: 6 - Load the dc comic data (/labs/data/dc-wikia-data.csv) in the table

paragraphs.text:
%md
Next we are going to create the ORC data format table

~~~
CREATE TABLE dc_comics_orc ( 
                        page_id string,
                        name string,
                        urlslug string,
                        ID string,
                        ALIGN string,
                        EYE string,
                        HAIR string,
                        SEX string,
                        GSM string,
                        ALIVE string,
                        APPEARANCES string,
                        FIRST_APPEARANCES string,
                        YEAR string
)  STORED AS ORC 
~~~

But first we need to drop the table if it already exists.

paragraphs.title: 8 - Drop the table if it exits and create the ORC stored table
9 - Load the data in table from external table and query the table.

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.text:
%md
### Hive table with data stored using avro schema
We are going to create a table with avro servde and avro schema.
The avro-tools utility can be used to generate the avro schema or sample.avsc

~~~
CREATE TABLE sample_table

ROW FORMAT

SERDE 'org.apache.hadoop.hive.serde2.avro.AvroSerDe'

WITH SERDEPROPERTIES (
    'avro.schema.url'='hdfs:///labs/data/sample.avsc')

STORED AS

INPUTFORMAT 'org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.io.avro.AvroContainerInputFormat'

OUTPUTFORMAT 'org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.io.avro.AvroContainerOutputFormat'
;
~~~

But first we need to drop the table if it already exists.

paragraphs.title: 10 - Drop table if it exists and create the  avro table

paragraphs.text:
%md
### SQL Practice
- Use the dc_comics_orc table for your practice queries.

paragraphs.title: 14 - Find all the character names that are good and are female. Put them in alphabetical order.( Limit 10)
paragraphs.text: %jdbc(hive_interactive)

paragraphs.title: 15 - List the name  and gender of the characters that have secret identities. Order by gender. Don't include characters with no gender (Limit 10)
paragraphs.text: %jdbc(hive_interactive)

paragraphs.title: 16 - Find the count of all the characters that have blue eyes and have blond hair
paragraphs.text: %jdbc(hive_interactive)

%md
### View metrics on the HiveServer2 Interactive UI
- Login to Ambari and click on the Hive Service
- Click on the link HiveServer2 Interactive UI under Quick Links

%md
# Result
**You have now:** You have now successfully created Hive tables that store data in multiple formats. As well as write several SQL statements to query the data.

---

%md
# Solution
---

paragraphs.title: 1 - Drop table dc_comics_acid_insert  transactional if it exists
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive_interactive)

DROP TABLE IF EXISTS dc_comics_parquet;

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: 2 - Create and describe the table
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive_interactive)
 CREATE TABLE dc_comics_parquet( 
                        page_id string,
                        name string,
                        urlslug string,
                        ID string,
                        ALIGN string,
                        EYE string,
                        HAIR string,
                        SEX string,
                        GSM string,
                        ALIVE string,
                        APPEARANCES string,
                        FIRST_APPEARANCES string,
                        YEAR string
) STORED AS Parquet;

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

LOAD DATA  INPATH '/labs/data/dc-wkia-data.parquet' OVERWRITE INTO TABLE dc_comics_parquet

Select * from dc_comics_parquet limit 5;

paragraphs.text:

CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE dc_comics_orc_raw ( 
                        page_id string,
                        name string,
                        urlslug string,
                        ID string,
                        ALIGN string,
                        EYE string,
                        HAIR string,
                        SEX string,
                        GSM string,
                        ALIVE string,
                        APPEARANCES string,
                        FIRST_APPEARANCES string,
                        YEAR string
) ROW FORMAT DELIMITED
FIELDS TERMINATED BY ',' LOCATION '/user/zeppelin/dc_comics/';

paragraphs.title: 10 - Drop table if it exists and create the  avro table
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive_interactive)
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS sample_table;
CREATE TABLE sample_table
ROW FORMAT
SERDE 'org.apache.hadoop.hive.serde2.avro.AvroSerDe'
WITH SERDEPROPERTIES (
    'avro.schema.url'='hdfs:///labs/data/sample.avsc')
STORED AS
INPUTFORMAT 'org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.io.avro.AvroContainerInputFormat'
OUTPUTFORMAT 'org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.io.avro.AvroContainerOutputFormat'
;

describe sample_table;

paragraphs.title: 14 - Find all the character names that are good and are female. Put them in alphabetical order. ( Limit 10)
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive_interactive)
Select name from dc_comics_orc where ALIGN='Good Characters' and SEX='Female Characters' limit 10

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: 15- List the name  and gender of the characters that have secret identities. Order by gender. Don't include characters with no gender (Limit 10)
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive_interactive)
Select name, sex from dc_comics_orc where ID = 'Secret Identity' and (sex ='Female Characters' or sex= 'Male Characters') order by sex

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: 16 - Find the count of all the characters that have blue eyes and have blond hair
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc(hive_interactive)
Select Count(*) as cnt from dc_comics_orc where eye= 'Blue Eyes' and hair ='Blond Hair'

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.text:
%md
We hope you've enjoyed this lab. Below are additional resources that you should find useful:

1. [Hortonworks Apache Spark Tutorials](http://hortonworks.com/tutorials/#tuts-developers) are your natural next step where you can explore Spark in more depth.
2. [Hortonworks Community Connection (HCC)](https://community.hortonworks.com/spaces/85/data-science.html?type=question) is a great resource for questions and answers on Spark, Data Analytics/Science, and many more Big Data topics.
3. [Hortonworks Apache Spark Docs](https://docs.hortonworks.com/HDPDocuments/HDP3/HDP-3.0.1/spark-overview/content/analyzing_data_with_apache_spark.html) - official Spark documentation.
4. [Hortonworks Apache Zeppelin Docs](https://docs.hortonworks.com/HDPDocuments/HDP3/HDP-3.0.1/zeppelin-overview/content/overview.html) - official Zeppelin documentation.
